Attributes.description: The psychology of gambling behaviour, with emphasis on relevant work from judgment and decision-making, the cognitive neuroscience of choice, and clinical perspectives on disordered gambling.
Attributes.prereq: Pre-reqs: Either (a) PSYC 100 or (b) two of PSYC 101, PSYC 102, PSYC 205, PSYC 207, PSYC 208, PSYC 216, PSYC 217, PSYC 277. (Strongly recommended: PSYC 101 and either PSYC 216 or one of PSYC 217 or 277.)
Attributes.date_buildings: Term: 1, Days: Mon Wed Fri, Start Time: 12:00, End Time: 13:00, Building: West, Room: Mall
